newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei ends up on Dow, Fed but off highs.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei ends up on Dow, Fed but off highs.

text.p: The SIMEX Nikkei futures closed firmer on Wednesday along with Wall Street, but dropped off their highs on profit-taking, dealers said.
After trading to a high at 21,460, light profit-taking pressured the key Nikkei 225 September contract to end at 21,285, some 80 ticks above its previous settlement. Its intraday low was at 21,220.
December ended at 21,300 against its previous close at 21,220. Total turnover for the two contracts was 20,500 lots.
Dealers said Nikkei was fuelled by the Dow's overnight gain after the Federal Open Market Committee decided on Tuesday to leave U.S. interest rates unchanged.
However, stable Japanese domestic market fundamentals capped any upside potential in futures as dealers were mostly sidelined ahead of the August 28 Tankan.
Most dealers were expecting the Tankan to be a non-event, reflecting a gradual improvement in the Japanese economy.
Near-term support and resistance for September remained at 20,800 and 21,600., dealers said.
